sn11.7:1.2: “Once upon a time, mendicants, as Sakka, lord of gods, was in private retreat this thought came to his mind,
sn11.7:1.3: ‘I should never betray even a sworn enemy.’
sn11.7:1.4: And then Vepacitti, lord of titans, knowing what Sakka was thinking, approached him.
sn11.7:1.5: Sakka saw Vepacitti coming off in the distance,
sn11.7:2.1: ‘Dear sir, don’t give up the idea you just had!’
sn11.7:3.1: ‘Swear, Vepacitti, that you won’t betray me.’
sn11.7:4.1: ‘Whatever bad things happen to a liar,
sn11.7:4.2: or to someone who slanders the noble ones,
sn11.7:4.3: or to someone who betrays a friend,
sn11.7:4.6: anyone who betrays you, Sujā’s husband.’”
